titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Mildred Haun Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

processinfo.head: Books in The Collection
processinfo.p: These books were part of Mildred Haun's papers and are now classified and in Special Collections:
Burrowes, J.F., The Piano-Forte Primer, Containing The Rudiments Of Music: Calculated Either For Private Tuition Or Teaching In Classes, Ditson and Company, Boston, New York, and Philadelphia.
Haun, Mildred, The Hawk's Done Gone, The Bobbs-Merrill Company, Indianapolis, New York, 1940.
Thomas, Jane H., Old Days In Nashville, Tennessee Reminiscences, Methodist Episcopal Church, South Publishing House, 1897.

scopecontent.p: Outgoing correspondence of 29 letters, 2 telegrams and 15 post cards. Chronologically arranged by days and months, letters are holograph, typescript, and carbon copies.. Four undated letters.

Incoming correspondence of 312 letters, 10 post cards, and 2 greeting cards, alphabetically arranged. Letters are typescript, holograph, and carbon copies. Five letters are without surnames, 1 is without any name, and 1 is signed only with the initials W M.

Material includes diaries dated 1934 and 1960-1961; an English notebook dated 1933; rough draft of last will and testament; miscellaneous notes, including names, addresses, and phone numbers; holograph notes on Mildred Haun's medical history; diplomas, chronologically arranged, awarded by Franklin Public Schools 1927, The Editors of the Christian Observer 1928, Tennessee Young People's Conference 1931, Tennessee Public County High School 1931, Vanderbilt University (B.A.) 1935, Vanderbilt University (M.A.) 1937. Certificates, chronologically arranged, include birth certificate; teacher's certificate issued by Tennessee Dept. of Education 1935; Dept. of the Air Force certificates of training 1957; U.S. Govt. Printing Office certificate of attendance 1961; U.S. Dept. of Agriculture Graduate School certificate 1962. Material also includes transcripts of grades; pamphlets on life insurance, surgical-medical benefit plans, retirement programs and social security; and"3 Blue Cross identification cards.
Eight of Mildred Haun, 43 photographs of quilts, bears, and miscellaneous country scenes.
Alphabetically and chronologically arranged, materials include bank statements; bills and receipts; cancelled checks; income tax forms and calculations; royalty statements.

Material consists of approximately 300 items, including applications for Federal employment; notices of rating; pamphlets; notifications of personnel action; pay roll change slips; position descriptions; requests for printing; time and attendance reports; travel authorizations and vouchers; miscellaneous notes on education and work experience. Materials alphabetically arranged by employer: U.S. Civil Service Commission; U.S. Department of Agriculture; U.S. Department of the Air Force; U.S. Department of the Army.

Material consists of approximately 300 items, including applications for Federal employment; notices of rating; pamphlets; notifications of personnel action; pay roll change slips; position descriptions; requests for printing; time and attendance reports; travel authorizations and vouchers; miscellaneous notes on education and work experience. Materials alphabetically arranged by employer: U.S. Civil Service Commission; U.S. Department of Agriculture; U.S. Department of the Air Force; U.S. Department of the Army.

Approximately 1500 holograph and typescript items. Material includes notes for story writing; notes on folk songs; riddles; superstitions; sayings; rhymes; remedies; tales; album verses; miscellaneous notes.

Approximately 1500 holograph and typescript items. Material includes notes for story writing; notes on folk songs; riddles; superstitions; sayings; rhymes; remedies; tales; album verses; miscellaneous notes.

Approximately 1500 holograph and typescript items. Material includes notes for story writing; notes on folk songs; riddles; superstitions; sayings; rhymes; remedies; tales; album verses; miscellaneous notes.

Approximately 1500 holograph and typescript items. Material includes notes for story writing; notes on folk songs; riddles; superstitions; sayings; rhymes; remedies; tales; album verses; miscellaneous notes.

Three hundred and fifty holograph and typescript folk songs alphabetically arranged by title. Spellings used are those given by writer of folk song. There are 32 untitled songs. Fragments of songs, lists of songs, and folk song questionnaire are found after titled folk songs.

did.unittitle: Mildred Haun's M.A. Thesis, Cocke County Ballads and Songs

scopecontent.p: Forty-five holograph and typescript stories alphabetically arranged. Untitled stories and fragmentary stories found after titled short stories. "Apple Tree"; "Barshia's Horse He Made, It Flew"; "The Boxwood"; "Counted A Thief"; "Dave Cocke's Motion"; "A Diamond In The Rough"; "A Feeling Of Pity"; "Flowers"; "For Lead"; "The Hawk's Done Gone"; "I Can Understand"; "Joe"; "The Look"; "The Man That Come To The Singing"; "Midnight"; "Neither Way"; "The Picture Frame"; "The Piece Of Silver"; "The Pit Of Death"; "The Red Flower Pot"; "The Root"; "Runner Girl"; "She Would"; "Shelled Corn For Lady"; "Shin-Bone Rocks"; "Snotty Gets A Shot"; "The Spot On The Sofa"; "The Spring Was Trusty"; "Then The Fire Went Out"; "The Turkey's Feather"; "Up And Down"; "The Warping Bars"; "A Wasp Sting"; "When The Wind Blows"; "Whirlwind"; "The White Dress"; "Wild Sallet"; "Yours Sincerely".

did.unittitle: Manuscript. Typescript, edited manuscript of The Hawk's Done Gone

scopecontent.p: Thirteen, alphabetically arranged by title. "Barshia's Horse He Made--- It Flew," World Digest, Oct. 1940; "Barshia's Horse He Made, It Flew," American Prefaces, Mar., 1940; "The Co-op Climate of Cerro Gordo County," News for Farmer Cooperatives, Dec, 1961; 'Doughnuts and Coffee (and a Happy Birthday," News for Farmer Cooperatives Sept. 1961; "Florida Indians Operate a Cooperative, News for Farmer Cooperatives, Mar., 1962; "IFCAI and the Fishermen of Mulfetta," Reprint from News for Farmer Cooperatives, Feb., 1962; "Mother York," The Nashville Tennessean, May 10, 1942; "Much Work and Some Play at SSC's 38th," News for Farmer Cooperatives, Feb.,1962; "New Crops", The Cotton Gin and Oil Mill Press, Feb. 2, 1963; "Teaching Machines Teaching Co-ops", News for Farmer Cooperatives, Aug., 1961; "The Turkey's Feather", Reprint from The Georgia Review, Winter, 1952; "Youth-In North Carolina", News for Farmer Cooperatives, Oct., 1961.

did.unittitle: Newspaper and Magazine Clippings About Mildred Haun

scopecontent.p: Material includes approximately 150 clippings about Mildred Haun and her novel The Hawk's Done Gone.

did.unittitle: Hershel Gower's Personal File As Literary Executor For Mildred Haun

scopecontent.p: Material includes 18 outgoing letters, chronologically arranged, most of which were written after the death of Mildred Haun; 4 typescript papers written by Hershel Gower, alphabetically arranged. "The Hawk's Done Gone: Mildred Haun and the Prose Ballads of Cocke County"; "Mildred Haun and the Persistence of Myth"; "Mildred Haun: The Persistence of the Supernatural"; "Mildred Haun: Story Teller and Folklorist(1911-1966)". Also included are: an uncorrected galley of The Sense of Fiction edited by Gower and Welker; a Table of contents for The Hawk's Done Gone and Other Stories by Mildred Haun, with an introduction by Hershel Gower; research notes; program of the thirty-second annual meeting of the Tennessee Folklore Society, Nov. 4-5, 1966; a xeroxed copy of a page from the Vanderbilt University Bulletin; an airplane ticket envelope; a list of items purchased by Claudelle L. Gaddis; an incomplete check and a checking account deposit slip also belonging to Claudelle L. Gaddis.

did.unittitle: Reviews of The Hawk's Done Gone

scopecontent.p: Five, alphabetically arranged by author: Chris Boner; John T. Frederick; Lera Knox; Julia Peterkin; Wilbur L. Schramm.

Material includes 33 typescript and holograph short stories not written by Mildred Haun, alphabetically arranged by title. Untitled stories found at end. Also included are 20 typescript essays and reports, alphabetically arranged by title.

"The Christmas Story"; "A Date With Hannibal"; "Ghost! (Maybe)"; "The Ghost"; "A Ghost Story"; "Ghost Story"; "A Ghost Tale"; "Ghost Tale"; "The Ghost"; "Grave Robbery"; "Haunted House"; "Looking After Clara"; "The Mason Family on Exhibition"; "My Ghost Story"; "The Old White Cow"; "The Preacher and the Ghost"; "The Sacred Mirror"; "Sleeping With a Corpse"; "The White Dog".

"Advice for Authors and Tips for Typists"; "Applying The 4-Star Rules"; "Before You Write...Analyze and Organize"; "Bibliography"; "A Forward Look At Farmer Cooperatives"; "The Game of Words"; "How To Write Effective Survey Reports That Sell Recommendations"; "Making Tables Talk"; "Management's Tower of Babel"; "Preparing An Effective Research Report I"; "Profits In Prose"; "Putting Journalism To Work In The Office"; "Reference Material in Information Division"; "The Retort Circumstantial"; "Rework-Edit-Evaluate"; "Snobs, Slobs, and the English Language"; "Style in Writing"; "Tables"; "When The Passive Voice?"; 1 untitled.

Material includes 2 newspapers and 2 Sunday magazines, chronologically arranged: The Review-Appeal, Franklin, Tenn., Oct. 14, 1937; The Knoxville Journal Sunday Magazine, Oct. 20, 1940; The Sunday Star This Week Magazine, Dec. 31, 1961; The Alexandria Gazette, Aug., 11, 1962. Also included are approximately 200 newspaper and magazine clippings of riddles and miscellaneous articles.

Eight, alphabetically arranged. All-American Square Dances; Echoes From Dixie; The Harp of Columbia; Jasper and Gold; My Homeland Tennessee; Old, Familiar Songs; Songs of Dixie; Star Collection of Old Favorite Songs

Forty-nine, alphabetically arranged. Material consists of 37 items. There are post cards, booklets, pamphlets, magazines, and guidebooks describing the tourist sites of New York, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Virginia, Washington, D. C., and West Virginia.
There are 31 art, literature, music, and theater programs, chronologically arranged.

Material consists of 16 maps of Tennessee counties, alphabetically arranged. Carter; Claiborne; Cocke; Grainger; Greene; Hamblen Hancock; Hawkins; Jefferson; Johnson; Knox; Sevier; Sullivan; Unicoi; Washington.

Material includes 2 calling cards; a statement of policies and regulations by the Director of Admissions and Registrar, State University of Iowa; a notice to contributors from The Georgia Review; an agreement and an assignment between Mildred Haun and the Bobbs-Merrill Company, dated 1940 and 1966; a prayer titled "I Believe" by Edwin Osgood Grover; an untitled, unsigned poem; an invitation to a church social; ticket stubbs; an advertisement for auto financing; a print by Auguste Renoir titled "Woman with a Cat".
